pull.title: refactor: Fix clang-tidy readability-const-return-type violations
pull.body: This comes up during review, so instead of wasting review cycles on this, just enforce it via CI

events.body:

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#26889](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26889) (refactor: wallet, remove global 'ArgsManager' dependency by furszy)
* [#26642](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26642) (clang-tidy: Add more `performance-*` checks and related fixes by hebasto)
* [#26627](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26627) (wallet: Migrate non-HD keys with single combo containing a list of keys by achow101)
* [#26596](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26596) (wallet: Migrate legacy wallets to descriptor wallets without requiring BDB by achow101)
* [#26152](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26152) (Bump unconfirmed ancestor transactions to target feerate by Xekyo)
* [#26008](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26008) (wallet: cache IsMine scriptPubKeys to improve performance of wallets with a lot of non-ranged descriptors by achow101)
* [#22693](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22693) (RPC/Wallet: Add "use_txids" to output of getaddressinfo by luke-jr)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

MSVC linker [error](https://api.cirrus-ci.com/v1/task/5351057543397376/logs/build.log):
```
libbitcoin_node.lib(validationinterface.obj) : error LNK2019: unresolved external symbol "class std::basic_string<char,struct std::char_traits<char>,class std::allocator<char> > const __cdecl RemovalReasonToString(enum MemPoolRemovalReason const &)" (?RemovalReasonToString@@YA?BV?$basic_string@DU?$char_traits@D@std@@V?$allocator@D@2@@std@@AEBW4MemPoolRemovalReason@@@Z) referenced in function "public: __cdecl `public: void __cdecl CMainSignals::TransactionRemovedFromMempool(class std::shared_ptr<class CTransaction const > const &,enum MemPoolRemovalReason,unsigned __int64)'::`4'::<lambda_2>::operator()(void)const " (??R<lambda_2>@?3??TransactionRemovedFromMempool@CMainSignals@@QEAAXAEBV?$shared_ptr@$$CBVCTransaction@@@std@@W4MemPoolRemovalReason@@_K@Z@QEBA@XZ) [C:\Users\ContainerAdministrator\AppData\Local\Temp\cirrus-ci-build\build_msvc\bitcoind\bitcoind.vcxproj]
```
Thanks, force pushed to remove `const` from `validationinterface.cpp` as well.

Fix clang-tidy readability-const-return-type violations

events.body:
utACK fa451d4b6

I verified that all the removed `const` qualifiers were top-level, and as such can be safely removed. Checking this with `clang-tidy` makes the review process more efficient.

ACK fa451d4b60ee0538b3ea6b946740a64734b35b6d.

Maybe add a commit to address https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26705#discussion_r1092977011 as well?

comments.body: A note: it looks not related to the `readability-const-return-type` check, but it does a few lines below in `ConsumeIntegralInRange<decltype(sz)>(0, sz - 1)`.
Correct, `decltype(sz)` is `const ...`, which will be the return value of `ConsumeIntegralInRange`, and thus cause the `readability-const-return-type` fail
